plantuml_diagram:
@startuml
!define AWSPuml https://raw.githubusercontent.com/awslabs/aws-icons-for-plantuml/v20.0/dist
!include AWSPuml/AWSCommon.puml

skinparam shadowing false
skinparam componentStyle rectangle
skinparam wrapWidth 200
skinparam maxMessageSize 200

title FreeIPA on AWS (Terraform Module) - High Level Deployment

actor "Operator / CI" as op

node "GitHub Actions\n(hashicorp/setup-terraform, setup-python, setup-go)" as gha {
  artifact "Terraform CLI" as tf
  artifact "Python tooling\n(pre-commit, scripts)" as py
}

cloud "AWS Account" as aws {
  node "VPC" as vpc {
    node "Private Subnets" as subnets {
      node "FreeIPA Cluster (3x EC2)" as ipa_cluster {
        node "EC2: ipa0\n(FreeIPA server)" as ipa0
        node "EC2: ipa1\n(FreeIPA server)" as ipa1
        node "EC2: ipa2\n(FreeIPA server)" as ipa2
      }

      node "Security Groups" as sgs {
        component "Server SG\n(FreeIPA servers)" as sg_server
        component "Client SG\n(FreeIPA clients)" as sg_client
        component "SG Rules\n(ingress/egress)" as sg_rules
      }
    }
  }

  database "DynamoDB\n(Terraform state lock)" as ddb
  storage "S3 Bucket\n(Terraform remote state)" as s3
  component "IAM Role/Policy\n(Provisioning permissions)" as iam
  component "SSM Parameter Store\n(CrowdStrike/Nessus values)" as ssm
  component "Route 53\n(Health checks + DNS: A/PTR/SRV/TXT)" as r53
}

op --> gha : push / manual run

gha --> tf : terraform init/plan/apply

tf --> s3 : read/write state

tf --> ddb : acquire/release lock

tf --> iam : assume/use role & policies

tf --> vpc : create/update resources

tf --> sgs : create SGs & rules

tf --> ipa_cluster : create EC2 instances

tf --> r53 : create records & health checks

tf --> ssm : read parameters (inputs)

sg_server -- ipa0
sg_server -- ipa1
sg_server -- ipa2
sg_client ..> sg_server : allowed client-to-server flows
sg_rules ..> sg_server
sg_rules ..> sg_client

r53 ..> ipa_cluster : DNS names / service discovery

note right of s3
backend.tf referenced in docs:
- S3 remote state
- DynamoDB locking
end note

note right of tf
remote_states.tf referenced in docs:
- consumes other stacks' outputs
end note

@enduml

architecture_description:
## High-level architecture (what this Terraform module deploys)

### Provisioning / delivery pipeline
- **Operator / CI (GitHub Actions)** runs the infrastructure workflow.
  - Uses **Terraform CLI** (via `hashicorp/setup-terraform@v3`) to `init/plan/apply`.
  - Uses **Python tooling** (setuptools/wheel; dev tools like pre-commit/ipython) for repo automation/validation.

### AWS infrastructure components
- **Terraform remote state backend** (referenced in docs):
  - **S3 bucket** stores Terraform state.
  - **DynamoDB table** provides state locking.
- **IAM policy + role policy attachment**: grants Terraform/provisioning permissions needed to create and configure the FreeIPA stack.
- **VPC (existing or created by a higher-level stack)** with **private subnets** hosting the FreeIPA servers.
- **FreeIPA server cluster**: **3 EC2 instances** (`ipa0`, `ipa1`, `ipa2`) deployed as a cluster.
- **Security Groups module (`security_groups/`)**:
  - **Server security group** attached to the FreeIPA EC2 instances.
  - **Client security group** intended for workloads that must talk to FreeIPA.
  - **Security group rules** define ingress/egress between client/server and other required ports.
- **Route 53**:
  - Creates **health checks** and DNS records required by FreeIPA/service discovery: **A, PTR, SRV, TXT**.
- **SSM Parameter Store**:
  - Provides configuration inputs (e.g., CrowdStrike/Nessus-related values) consumed by Terraform during provisioning.

### Key relationships / flows
- GitHub Actions  Terraform: executes `terraform init/plan/apply`.
- Terraform  S3/DynamoDB: stores state and coordinates locking.
- Terraform  IAM: uses attached permissions to manage AWS resources.
- Terraform  EC2/Security Groups/Route53: provisions the FreeIPA cluster, network controls, and DNS/health checks.
- Route 53  FreeIPA cluster: DNS names and service discovery point to the EC2 instances.
- Client SG  Server SG: rules allow client-to-server FreeIPA traffic.

### Notes from repository docs
- `backend.tf` and `remote_states.tf` are referenced in documentation but not present in the provided snapshot; the diagram models them as external/expected parts of the overall deployment pattern.
